required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vitamin B12 for Aromatase Inhibitors Musculoskeletal Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Arm Phase II Study of Oral Vitamin B12 for the Treatment of Aromatase Inhibitors (AI) Associated Musculoskeletal Symptoms in Women With Early Stage Breast Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center, El Paso

clinical_study.source: Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center, El Paso

brief_summary.textblock: Significant Aromatase Inhibitor-associated toxicity, affects as many as 50% of patients with breast cancer leading to early discontinuation of this life-saving cancer treatment. No effective pharmacologic therapy has yet been identified for management of these symptoms, as many patients do not experience relief of symptoms with analgesic therapy. Vitamin B12, whether as injection or oral forms, has been used as a naturopathic product to provide relief for joint pain caused by arthritis. This effect has not been studied in the setting of Aromatase Inhibitor-Associated Musculoskeletal Symptoms (AIMSS).

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Objectives:
a. To assess whether daily oral Vitamin B12 decreases average joint pain in women with aromatase inhibitor-associated musculoskeletal symptoms (AIMSS), as measured at baseline, 6 weeks and at 12 weeks by the modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (BPI-SF).
Secondary Objectives:
1. To investigate whether daily vitamin B12 improves functional quality of life as measured by the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Endocrine Scale (FACT-ES);
2. To explore the impact of treatment on serum inflammatory cytokine levels (C Reactive Protein) with 12 weeks of treatment between baseline and 12 weeks.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Vitamin B12 is to be taken sublingually on a daily basis for 90 days

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Average Joint Pain in Women With Aromatase Inhibitor-associated Musculoskeletal Symptoms (AIMSS) Compared to Baseline as Measured by the Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (BPI-SF).
primary_outcome.description: The Brief Pain Inventory - Short Form (BPI- SF) average pain score used. This item has a scale of 0 to 10 with 0 indicating "No pain" and 10 indicating "Pain as bad as you can imagine" We expect at least 20% improvement in BPI-SF pain scores. Participants were asked to rate worst pain an average pain within the last 24 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Worst Pain at the End of Treatment .
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of the data collected at baseline and at the end of treatment in the BPI-SF questionnaire. The Brief Pain Inventory - Short Form (BPI- SF) worst pain score used. This item has a scale of 0 to 10 with 0 indicating "No pain" and 10 indicating "Pain as bad as you can imagine". Participants were asked to rate worst pain an average pain within the last 24 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Functional Quality of Life as Measured by the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Endocrine Scale (FACT-ES)
secondary_outcome.description: All of the items in this questionnaire have a 5 scale rating, from not at all (0) to very much (4). Outcomes were measured pre and post treatment. Version 4 of the FACT-ES contains 3 subscales with seven questions: Physical Well-Being (PWB) (score range 0-28), Functional Well-Being (FWB) (score range 0-28), and Social and Well-Being (SWB) (score range 0-28); Emotional Well-Being (EWB) (score range 0-24) with six questions, and the Endocrine Symptom Subscale (ESS) (score range 0-76) containing 19 questions. For all subscale a higher score represents better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change of Serum Levels of Vitamin B12, C-reactive Protein (CRP), Homoscyteine (HCys) and Methylmalonic Acid (MMA).
secondary_outcome.description: Inflammatory markers were measured pre and post treatment.

intervention.description: Vitamin B12 2500 micrograms sublingually per day over the course of 90 days (+/- 10 days)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sign informed consent and Pain level > 4 in the BPI scale,
- Stage I-III
Exclusion Criteria:
- <18 yrs
- Stage IV
- BPI Score <4
- Zubrod score >2

overall_official.affiliation: Texas Tech University HSC El Paso

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center, El Paso

participant_flow.recruitment_details: we needed at least a total of 30 patients to achieve more than 85% power to detect the differences in BPI-SF pain scores relative to baseline using a two tailed paired t-test with 5% level of significance. After accounting for 15% dropouts, we estimated to include at least 35 patients in the study.

group.description: Oral Vitamin B12 Vitamin B12: Vitamin B12 2500 micrograms sublingually per day over the course of 90 days (+/- 10 days)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Average Joint Pain in Women With Aromatase Inhibitor-associated Musculoskeletal Symptoms (AIMSS) Compared to Baseline as Measured by the Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (BPI-SF).
outcome.description: The Brief Pain Inventory – Short Form (BPI- SF) average pain score used. This item has a scale of 0 to 10 with 0 indicating “No pain” and 10 indicating “Pain as bad as you can imagine" We expect at least 20% improvement in BPI-SF pain scores. Participants were asked to rate worst pain an average pain within the last 24 hours.
outcome.population: A total of forty-one patients were enrolled, five patients withdrew, leaving thirty-six patients to complete the study.

measure.title: Percentage Change in Average Joint Pain in Women With Aromatase Inhibitor-associated Musculoskeletal Symptoms (AIMSS) Compared to Baseline as Measured by the Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (BPI-SF).
measure.description: The Brief Pain Inventory – Short Form (BPI- SF) average pain score used. This item has a scale of 0 to 10 with 0 indicating “No pain” and 10 indicating “Pain as bad as you can imagine" We expect at least 20% improvement in BPI-SF pain scores. Participants were asked to rate worst pain an average pain within the last 24 hours.

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Worst Pain at the End of Treatment .
outcome.description: Analysis of the data collected at baseline and at the end of treatment in the BPI-SF questionnaire. The Brief Pain Inventory - Short Form (BPI- SF) worst pain score used. This item has a scale of 0 to 10 with 0 indicating "No pain" and 10 indicating "Pain as bad as you can imagine". Participants were asked to rate worst pain an average pain within the last 24 hours.
outcome.population: Postmenopausal women with ER+ breast cancer, stages I-III on aromatase inhibitors and musculoskeletal pain (average pain level > or=4 using BPI-SF)

group.description: Oral Vitamin B12 Vitamin B12: Vitamin B12 2500 micrograms sublingually per day over the course of 90 days (+/- 10 days)

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Functional Quality of Life as Measured by the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Endocrine Scale (FACT-ES)
outcome.description: All of the items in this questionnaire have a 5 scale rating, from not at all (0) to very much (4). Outcomes were measured pre and post treatment. Version 4 of the FACT-ES contains 3 subscales with seven questions: Physical Well-Being (PWB) (score range 0-28), Functional Well-Being (FWB) (score range 0-28), and Social and Well-Being (SWB) (score range 0-28); Emotional Well-Being (EWB) (score range 0-24) with six questions, and the Endocrine Symptom Subscale (ESS) (score range 0-76) containing 19 questions. For all subscale a higher score represents better quality of life.
outcome.population: postemneopausal women with ER + , Stages I-III breast cancer

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Five of 41 participants did not complete the study medications and were not analyzed

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Zeina Nahleh, MD (previoulsy PI at Texas Tech university HSC-EP)
